page.title: 16Social Concerns
page.content: After consulting with members of the public we, with their help have reached some conclusions. Firstly because of the new by-pass missing the Cowdenbeath area, much needed trade for local shops is being diverted past Cowdenbeath. The exit road from the by-pass is on Bridge Street which means that there will be a heavy influx of vehicles through the Main Street of Cowdenbeath, which could cause problems of safety for pedestrians. The other problem for the local shop-keepers is the new supermarket which is present under construction. The shops at the bottom end of the town are likely to lose custom to a large supermarket. Another question raised was would the supermarket be profitable. People thought that this was a bad idea.
